definition: to do sth in place of sb else
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: Is there anything else I could do for you while you wait?
sentences.chinese: 您等候時，還有其他要代勞嗎？

sentences.english: Well, the Penguin Tea Timer happily does the waiting for you.
sentences.chinese: 現在企鵝泡茶定時器可以幫你代勞啦。

sentences.english: If I can be of any service during your convalescence, be sure to let me know.
sentences.chinese: 在你康復期間，我如能代勞的事，務必告知。

sentences.english: This measure may preclude the exclusive agency from selling crucial crude oil.
sentences.chinese: 這個措施可以使專有的代勞代理不克出售抉擇的原油。

sentences.english: Since he can't put his ideas over clearly enough, allow me to speak on his behalf.
sentences.chinese: 他不能清楚地表達自己的想法，所以，就讓我代勞吧。

sentences.english: Haiti can’t be reconstructed by well-meaning outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 海地重建不能由好心的局外人代勞。

sentences.english: If our delegate is unable to attend, we shall have to call on his deputy's services.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們的代表不能出席，我們就請他的副手代勞。

sentences.english: The rest of the time their mothers or wives do it for them.
sentences.chinese: 其餘時間則由母親或妻子代勞。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
